column2: ----Huntington Seacliff Elementary School\r6701 Garfield Avenue • Huntington Beach
column4: Principal\rmandrzejewski@hbcsd.us\rseacliff-huntington-ca.schoolloop.com\r\r-2018-19 School Accountability Report Card\r---\rPublished During the 2019-20 School Year\r\rSchool Description\rWe envision a community of learners where:\r•All children learn and achieve grade level standards.\r•Clearlyarticulated
column6: andresearchbasedinstructionisalignedtothe\rCommon Core Standards.\r•Positive values and strong character are encouraged within our students.\r•Staffdevelopment
column11: and nurtured.\rDistrict\r•Open communication and collaboration exists between all members of the school\r8750 Dorsett Drive\rcommunity.\rHuntington Beach
column12: CA 92646\r•Students are prepared for participation in the culturally diverse
column14: \r(714) 964-8888\rdemocratic society of the twenty-first century.\rwww.hbcsd.us\rThe Huntington Seacliff school community places a high value on education. This value is evidenced\rDistrict Governing Boardbyaphenomenaldegreeofparentalinvolvementandgenerousparticipationbytheschool\rBridget Kaubcommunity. Volunteers contribute countless hours assisting in classrooms
column18: Ed. D.\r\rDiana Marks\rSeacliff's 27 classrooms surround shared learning corridors that are designed with networked\rAnn Sullivan\rlearning stations. The open architecture of the corridors allows resources of the mind and materials\r\rto be shared with ease. It facilitates peer coaching as both teachers and students learn from each\rDistrict Administrationother. Our state-of-the-art library media center serves as the resource and technological heart of\rGregory Haulkthe school. Currently
column21: is being piloted with a 21st Century makeover as\rSuperintendentpart of the renovation plan from the passage of the Measure Q bond. Plan have been approved for\rCynthia Guerrero
column22: Ed.D.modernization to begin in summer 2020.\rAssistant Superintendent\rEducational Services\rStepping into a classroom at Seacliff
column23: one would immediately take notice of the warm
column25: and\rPatricia Hagersupportive tone that permeates the school climate. The Seacliff Code of Conduct clearly defines\rAssistant Superintendentbehaviorexpectationsandconsequences
column31: defining expectations for moral and ethical decision-making
column32: and acceptance of\rpersonal responsibility. Visitors often comment on the campus orderliness
column34: and comfortable spirit at Seacliff School.\r\rRecent honors support the staff and community's commitment to making a difference. In June\r2014
column35: the school was honored as a 2014 Distinguished School recipient. In October 2014
column36: the school\rwas awarded the highest honor of being named a 2014 National Blue Ribbon School. Seacliff was\ralso honored with the 2015 California Gold Ribbon Award.  ... Unnamed: 5
